fields.title: Documents
fields.message: Create, store and share files that are associated to tasks within your projects. You can download files locally and upload new versions.

fields.title: Uploading Documents
fields.message: Uploading documents is as simple as drag and drop your files onto Proxy. Once uploaded you can associate it with a Project, Workflow or Task your assigned to.

fields.title: Get Piece of Mind
fields.message: Files you upload can only be accessed to members that are associated to the  Project, Workflow or Task you assign the file to.

fields.title: Groups
fields.message: Bring the right people and information together with groups. As an admin you can create and edit groups, group names are displayed on all projects, workflows and tasks to show who is responsible.

fields.title: Adding Groups
fields.message: Groups can be created and managed by admins only. Simply define a recognizable name and add the members you’d like to include in the group. Members are then automatically invited to that group.

fields.title: Managing Groups
fields.message:
Members can be added to multiple groups at the same time.
You can manage what members on in each group at anytime. If a group is no longer needed, simply delete and re assign the members to a new group

fields.title: Projects
fields.message:
A Project is generally a formal legal or business project known within the company. Projects generally include multiple Workflows, which in turn contain many Tasks. For example, a Project could relate to litigation in which the company is engaged (e.g. Doe v. Company), with multiple Workflows related to the stages of litigation - for example Answer & Affirmative Defenses, Written Discovery, Depositions, Motions, and Trial. 

A Project could also relate to a key customer to negotiate and track multiple POs or SOWs, or it could relate to a large transaction, e.g. Letter of Intent, Diligence, Master Purchase Agreement, or the like.

fields.title: Tasks
fields.message: A Task in Proxy is any discrete piece of legal work to be done. It could be reviewing a document, drafting a policy, answering an executive's question, or filing a brief. Tasks may be ad hoc and stand on their own, or they may be part of a larger Workflow.

fields.title: Introducing Discussions
fields.message: Notes is now discussions. A new way to collaborate over workflows, projects and tasks. Whether it’s everyone in the group or an individual.

fields.title: Multiple members or just one.
fields.message: You’re always in control when it comes to what you want to share. you can choose to send it to the entire group or just one contact.

fields.title: Send Documents
fields.message:
Securely send documents without the need to leave the screen,
Documents can be sent to everyone in the team or a specific member.

fields.title: Welcome to Proxy
fields.message: You’re all set! Your dashboard gives you an overview of the projects, workflows and tasks your assigned too.

fields.title: Adding Team Members
fields.message: Welcome to Company Management. As your role as an Admin, here you can add the rest of your team and define permissions and groups.

fields.title: Manually Add Members
fields.message: You can add members at anytime. Simply invite users by email and define the permissions you would like to give.

fields.title: Mass Invite
fields.message: Have a large amount of user to add? Simply copy and paste all the emails and Proxy will create multiple accounts at the same time.

fields.title: Tags
fields.message: Find your projects, workflows and tasks easier with tags. You can define multiple tags and use the filters around Proxy to get to your project, workflow and task fast.

fields.title: Workflows
fields.message:
A Workflow is a collection of Tasks or any legal matter that requires multiple steps or people. For example, the drafting, revision, and approval of a contract or legal brief may require multiple people and multiple iterations of the relevant document. 

Each discrete step in the process may be a Task, but the entire process (that is, all of the Tasks together) is a Workflow. Where as a Task normally has one owner and one person assigned to the Task, a Workflow may have many people 
assigned or included.
